diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis of osteochondritis dissecans was supported by the patient's clinical presentation of pain and swelling in the PIP joint, the initial X-ray findings interpreted as a non-union of a fracture, and further imaging (CT and MRI) showing details consistent with osteochondritis dissecans, such as sclerosis of the dorsal epiphyseal fragment and a high signal between epiphyseal fragments on T2-weighted MRI sequences.
